protein.specific_function: Can reduce the dialdehyde protein-binding form of aflatoxin B1 (AFB1) to the non-binding AFB1 dialcohol. May be involved in protection of liver against the toxic and carcinogenic effects of AFB1, a potent hepatocarcinogen

reference.reference_text: Knight LP, Primiano T, Groopman JD, Kensler TW, Sutter TR: cDNA cloning, expression and activity of a second human aflatoxin B1-metabolizing member of the aldo-keto reductase superfamily, AKR7A3. Carcinogenesis. 1999 Jul;20(7):1215-23.
